channel.title: PK Point Shops
channel.description: My Pk point shops say the Pk point price, But they are all scrambled and messed up, Whenever I click an item to see the price it will say something such as "*this item* costs 1000Pk points" and then I go to buy it and it says, You dont have enough coins? Lol? [b]This is a 317 PI[/b] And in the same shop I have bought an Item with Pk points Before.. If you need me to show any code of these shops lets me know where its at that needs showing, Thank you for your time, Sincerely, Trade me

item.title: PK Point Shops
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

You need to add the check when buying an item.

if (c.myShopId == #) {
    handleOtherShop();
}

I believe this is it, I don’t remember, I haven’t messed with PI’s shops in awhile.

Read full topic

item.title: PK Point Shops
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

Find a tutorial about adding points, it will show how to make it say “Yo do not have enough pk points”. İ have added points before and i have everything in correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: PK Point Shops
item.dc:creator: @alexis1 alexis1
item.description:
@alexis1 wrote:

remove the item id that u can pay with both pk points and gp from the prices.txt

Read full topic

item.title: PK Point Shops
item.dc:creator: @Trade_Me Trade Me
item.description:
@Trade_Me wrote:

[quote=“alexis1, post:3, topic:445523”]Open shopassisant.java
case = item id
return = item price

this is only for donor and pk point shops[/quote]

Yes, I know that… But the thing is… I still have the correct items in there, Yet I still can buy some items with coins and some with PK points…
Lets say for example I put this:

case 14484:
return 850;
When I go to the shop and click it, It will say “Dragon Claws are 850 Pk points.” But then when I try to buy it… It says “You dont have enough coins.”
If you dont understand, Let me know… I’m trying to explain it the best I can

Read full topic

return = item price

@jake.bellotti wrote:

the prices it outputs are different to the actual price. if using pi, use prices.txt to edit prices.
